8th International Workshop on
Trends in Linear Logic and Applications

TLLA 2024

Tallinn, Estonia
23-28 February 2026

Accepted Papers

1. Pedro H. Azevedo de Amorim. An enriched calculus for kernels and linear operators.
2. Davide Barbarossa. Stability property for the Call-by-Value lambda-calculus through Taylor expansion.
3. Mikołaj Bojańczyk, Lê Thành Dũng Nguyễn, Rafał Stefański. Function spaces for orbit-finite sets.
4. Antonio Bucciarelli, Raffaele Di Donna, Lorenzo Tortora de Falco. Injectivity of the coherent model for a fragment of connected MELL proof-nets.
5. Luis Caires. On expressing stateful computation in linear logic.
6. Stefano Catozi. Normalization in multiplicative exponential linear logic via Taylor expansion.
7. Jacopo Furlan. The art of realizability.
8. Wesley Fussner, Simon Santschi. Interpolation in extensions of linear logic.
9. Giulio Guerrieri. The theory of meaningfulness in the Call-by-Value lambda-calculus.
10. Jean-Simon Lemay, Marie Kerjean. Laplace transformation and symmetry in differential linear logic.
11. Morgan Rogers. A supply of functorial models of linear logic.
12. Thomas Seiller. An axiomatic presentation of linear realizability.
13. Riley Shahar, Steve Zdancewic. Categorical phase semantics for linear logic.
14. Niccolò Veltri, Cheng-Syuan Wan. Craig interpolation for semi-substructural logics.

CSL 2026 - 34th EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic
